oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Larry Gatlin Live at the Lincoln Center -- 1978-08-24
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is from the Lincoln Center live show. The tape features a live performance of Larry Gatlin (musician). The Lincoln Center live show is presented by Mort Cooperman, Bill McGivney and the WHN radio network. The recording of Larry Gatlin is from August 22, 1978.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Larry Gatlin
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Lee Arnold introduces the Lone Star Café and Larry Gatlin -- (00:35) Broken Lady (Larry Gatlin) -- (3:04) Statues Without Hearts (Larry Gatlin) -- (05:31) Gatlin shows his appreciation to the crowd, and Gatlin checks his monitor levels -- (08:05) Love is Just a Game (Larry Gatlin) -- (11:24) Gatlin introduces his bandmates -- (12:24) I Don't Wanna Cry (Larry Gatlin) -- (15:09) Gatlin interacts with the audience -- (17:40) The Heart (Larry Gatlin) -- (20:42) Gatlin addresses the radio audience, and Gatlin recalls discussing New York with a friend -- (22:40) Gatlin reflects on the movie qualities of ""Penny Annie"" -- (23:13) Penny Annie (Larry Gatlin) -- (27:36) Gatlin praises his brothers -- (28:46) Night Time Magic (Larry Gatlin) -- (31:03) Do it Again Tonight (Larry Gatlin) -- (34:05) Gatlin reflects on how ""I Just Wish You Were Someone I Love"" went number one -- (35:31) I Just Wish You Were Someone I Love (Larry Gatlin) -- (37:58) Don't Blame Me For Colorado (Larry Gatlin) -- (41:55) Arnold praises the Gatlin Brothers and performs his closing statements -- (42:24) I Was Falling [featuring unidentified female voiceover] (Jesse Williams)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gatlin, Larry; Gatlin, Larry, 1948-;
